name: Multi-Cloud Managed Services Transformation
description: The foundational transformation of Rackspace's core business model from single-cloud managed hosting to multi-cloud managed services spanning AWS, Azure, and GCP. Disclosed in every annual 10-K as the primary strategic direction. Encompasses the restructuring of service delivery around three cloud pillars (Public Cloud, Private Cloud, Data and AI), retraining of 7,000+ technical staff on hyperscaler platforms, and repositioning of Rackspace as the leading managed service provider for enterprise multi-cloud environments. Includes sunsetting of legacy managed hosting revenue streams.
okrs_fy2025: Grow multi-cloud bookings to 70%+ of total new ARR
Complete 500+ legacy hosting customer migrations
Achieve tri-cloud delivery certification for 3,000+ technical staff
Launch Rackspace Fabric 2.0 orchestration layer
Reduce legacy dedicated hosting revenue to under 25% of total ARR

quarterly_milestones_fy2025.Q1: APAC multi-cloud delivery model operational; Fabric 2.0 beta
quarterly_milestones_fy2025.Q2: Public Cloud Managed Services 2.0 GA; 150 customer migrations
quarterly_milestones_fy2025.Q3: 350 cumulative migrations; tri-cloud certification 50% complete
quarterly_milestones_fy2025.Q4: 500 migrations; 70% multi-cloud bookings target achieved

name: Project Eagle — Cost Reduction and Operational Efficiency
description: Named operational efficiency program disclosed in Rackspace 10-K filings and earnings calls, targeting annualized cost reductions of $100M+ through workforce optimization, vendor contract renegotiations, data center footprint rationalization, and automation of managed service delivery processes. Includes reductions in headcount disclosed in SEC filings (2023-2024 restructuring charges), consolidation of data center operations, and automation-driven reduction in support labor costs. Partially funded by Apollo portfolio governance framework.
okrs_fy2025: Deliver $100M+ annualized cost reduction run-rate by Q4 FY2025
Complete data center footprint consolidation to 11 core facilities
Automate 40% of tier-1 managed services support interactions
Reduce vendor spend by 15% through renegotiated MSAs
Achieve workforce optimization targets with <5% voluntary attrition impact

quarterly_milestones_fy2025.Q1: Vendor renegotiation phase 2 complete; automation tooling deployed to SAT2/DFW
quarterly_milestones_fy2025.Q2: $50M annualized savings run-rate achieved; 2 data centers consolidated
quarterly_milestones_fy2025.Q3: Support automation at 30% interaction coverage; workforce rebalancing complete
quarterly_milestones_fy2025.Q4: $100M target achieved; program closeout and sustain model handed to Ops

name: AI and Generative AI Services Launch
description: Strategic initiative to build and launch Rackspace AI and Generative AI managed services portfolio. Publicly announced at AWS re:Invent 2023 and Microsoft Ignite 2023. Includes launch of Rackspace AI Developer Experience (AIDE), Rackspace Microsoft Copilot Services, Palantir AI Platform partnership (ctr-018), and Rackspace Private AI solutions. Initiative encompasses hiring of AI engineers, development of AI governance frameworks, and construction of GPU-enabled bare metal and cloud offerings. Disclosed as key revenue growth driver in 2024 investor materials.
okrs_fy2025: Close 50+ net new AI/GenAI managed services contracts in FY2025
Launch AIDE (AI Developer Experience) platform GA with 3+ reference customers
Achieve $50M AI services ARR by end of FY2025
Complete Palantir AIP co-delivery certification for 200 engineers
Launch Rackspace Private AI on bare metal for regulated industry verticals

quarterly_milestones_fy2025.Q1: AIDE beta GA; first 10 Copilot Services contracts signed; GPU cluster expansion SIN2
quarterly_milestones_fy2025.Q2: Palantir AIP certification cohort 1 complete; $15M AI ARR milestone
quarterly_milestones_fy2025.Q3: Private AI bare metal offer in 3 regions; 30 AIDE production deployments
quarterly_milestones_fy2025.Q4: $50M AI ARR; 50 net new contracts; AIDE 2.0 roadmap published

name: Federal Government Cloud Expansion (FedRAMP ATO)
description: Multi-year initiative to expand Rackspace Government Cloud offerings and achieve and maintain FedRAMP authorization for AWS and Azure managed service delivery. Rackspace Government Cloud achieved FedRAMP authorization (JAB P-ATO). Reston Federal Government Office (site-002) serves as delivery center. Encompasses GSA MAS (ctr-026) and SEWP V (ctr-027) contract vehicles, DoD IL2/IL4 workload certifications, and dedicated federal sales force. Revenue opportunity from G-Cloud, SEWP, and TIPS government cooperative vehicles.
initiative_lead: Thomas Cole (SVP Federal / Board Director, EMP-089)
okrs_fy2025: Maintain FedRAMP JAB P-ATO for AWS and Azure managed service delivery
Grow federal managed cloud ARR by 20% YoY in FY2025
Achieve DoD IL4 authorization for at least one workload type
Win 3+ new agency task orders under SEWP V and GSA MAS vehicles
Staff Reston Federal Office to 150 cleared personnel

quarterly_milestones_fy2025.Q1: FedRAMP annual assessment complete; DoD IL4 authorization package submitted
quarterly_milestones_fy2025.Q2: 2 SEWP V task orders awarded; Reston headcount at 120
quarterly_milestones_fy2025.Q3: DoD IL4 authorization received; federal ARR at 110% of Q3 target
quarterly_milestones_fy2025.Q4: 20% federal ARR growth achieved; 3 new agency task orders; IL4 delivery operational

name: Debt Restructuring and Balance Sheet Optimization
description: Multi-phase initiative to restructure Rackspace's debt obligations following the 2021 IPO and subsequent market deterioration. Includes 2023 out-of-court debt exchange that converted First Lien Second Out (FLSO) term loans and 5.375% Senior Notes (ctr-012) into new FLSO Senior Secured Notes due 2028 (ctr-011). New Revolving Credit Facility (ctr-013) and Receivables Purchase Facility (ctr-014) established. Initiative targets leverage ratio reduction and liquidity improvement while maintaining operational funding. Apollo governance framework (ctr-025) provides oversight.
okrs_fy2025: Reduce net leverage ratio to below 6.0x by end of FY2025
Maintain $300M+ liquidity headroom through Revolving Credit Facility
Complete second lien exchange or refinancing of FLSO notes due 2028
Achieve FCF breakeven or positive on adjusted basis in H2 FY2025
Execute Receivables Purchase Facility utilization at ≥80% capacity

quarterly_milestones_fy2025.Q1: Q4 FY2024 covenant compliance confirmed; RCF utilization reviewed with Apollo
quarterly_milestones_fy2025.Q2: Leverage ratio update to board; refinancing options analysis complete
quarterly_milestones_fy2025.Q3: FCF trajectory confirmed positive; RPF at 80% utilization
quarterly_milestones_fy2025.Q4: Net leverage <6.0x; liquidity >$300M; FY2026 debt maturity wall addressed

name: OpenStack and Private Cloud Business Reinvention
description: Strategic repositioning of Rackspace's OpenStack heritage business and private cloud offerings. Addresses the challenge of transitioning long-standing OpenStack customers to modern managed cloud platforms while preserving the revenue base. Includes OpenStack on Metal (bare metal IaaS with OpenStack), VMware private cloud (Rackspace Private Cloud powered by VMware), and hybrid cloud connectivity products. OpenStack contributor relationship with OpenInfra Foundation maintained. VMware ELA transition (ctr-033) managed under this initiative.
initiative_lead: Jon Mullapudy (SVP & GM OpenStack & Private Cloud, EMP-093)
okrs_fy2025: Retain 90%+ of existing OpenStack/private cloud ARR through managed transition
Launch OpenStack on Metal 3.0 with Ironic-native orchestration
Complete VMware ELA transition to Broadcom licensing model by Q2
Convert 100+ OpenStack customers to hybrid cloud connectivity bundles
Achieve 30% gross margin improvement in private cloud segment

quarterly_milestones_fy2025.Q4: 100 hybrid bundle conversions; 30% GM improvement in private cloud confirmed

name: APAC Business Growth and Capability Build
description: Multi-year program to build Rackspace's APAC managed cloud revenue and delivery capability, with focus on Australia, Singapore, Hong Kong, and India markets. Encompasses expansion of SYD2 and SIN2 data center presence, hiring of local delivery engineers (Luke McLean ANZ, Ramesh Babu India-SEA team), partnership with telcos and GSIs in region, and capture of Australian government contracts (Queensland Government, cust-085). AWS and Azure managed services revenue in APAC is the primary KPI.
initiative_lead: Martin Dubé (VP Public Cloud APJ, EMP-096)
okrs_fy2025: Grow APAC managed cloud ARR by 35% YoY in FY2025
Win Queensland State Government contract renewal and 2 new ANZ public sector accounts
Achieve AWS Premier Partner status in Australia and Singapore
Staff India engineering hub to 300 cloud-certified engineers
Launch Rackspace APAC AI managed services with 5 reference customers

quarterly_milestones_fy2025.Q4: 35% APAC ARR growth confirmed; India hub at 300; 2 new ANZ public sector wins

name: Security Operations Center (SOC) Modernization and Cyber Recovery
description: Post-incident security modernization program initiated following the November 2023 ransomware attack on Rackspace's Hosted Exchange environment. Encompasses complete decommission of legacy Exchange infrastructure (INIT-009), SOC capability rebuild, SIEM platform upgrade, zero-trust network access (ZTNA) deployment, endpoint detection and response (EDR) refresh, and executive cybersecurity governance improvements. Rubrik cyber recovery partnership (ctr-023) is a direct output of this initiative. Target completion aligned with customer SLA restoration.
okrs_fy2025: Hire and onboard permanent CISO by end of Q1 FY2025
Achieve SOC 2 Type II re-certification covering all managed cloud service lines
Deploy ZTNA to 100% of remote workforce by Q3 FY2025
Complete EDR refresh across all 7,000+ managed endpoints
Reduce mean time to detect (MTTD) to under 15 minutes for critical severity events

quarterly_milestones_fy2025.Q1: CISO hired; SIEM platform upgrade complete; Rubrik Cyber Recovery deployed in 3 regions
quarterly_milestones_fy2025.Q2: ZTNA deployed to 70% of remote workforce; SOC 2 audit commenced
quarterly_milestones_fy2025.Q3: ZTNA 100% coverage; EDR refresh complete; SOC 2 Type II audit complete
quarterly_milestones_fy2025.Q4: MTTD <15 minutes confirmed in tabletop exercise; CISO 90-day plan published to board

name: Hosted Exchange Decommission and Microsoft 365 Migration
description: Emergency project to decommission Rackspace's legacy Microsoft Hosted Exchange environment following the November 2023 ransomware attack by PLAY ransomware group. Project involved migrating all affected customers to Microsoft 365 / Exchange Online at no charge, as disclosed in Rackspace SEC 8-K filings and class action lawsuit context. Microsoft Exchange Online Hosted (PRD-027) and Microsoft 365 Managed (PRD-028) products were accelerated as customer transition paths. Customer credits and legal settlement costs materialized. Project completed Q1 2024.
okrs_fy2025: N/A — initiative completed Q1 FY2024
Post-completion: monitor legal exposure from class action lawsuits through FY2025
Ensure M365 customer satisfaction NPS recovery to pre-incident baseline by Q2 FY2025

quarterly_milestones_fy2025.Q1: COMPLETED — all Hosted Exchange customers migrated to M365 Exchange Online
quarterly_milestones_fy2025.Q2: Legal settlement fund established; customer NPS recovery survey administered
quarterly_milestones_fy2025.Q3: Class action litigation status review; insurance recovery proceedings
quarterly_milestones_fy2025.Q4: Incident lessons-learned published internally; security architecture improvements validated

name: SAP on Azure Managed Services Growth Initiative
description: Strategic initiative to capture the growing enterprise SAP RISE with Microsoft and SAP S/4HANA migration market. Rackspace is a certified SAP on Azure managed service provider. Initiative encompasses hiring of SAP Basis engineers, development of accelerated SAP migration tooling, partnerships with SAP services integrators, and go-to-market in manufacturing, CPG (General Mills, cust-083), and retail sectors. Azure Expert MSP designation (ctr-029) enables co-sell with Microsoft SAP teams.
okrs_fy2025: Grow SAP on Azure managed services ARR by 40% YoY in FY2025
Achieve SAP Recognized Expertise designation for S/4HANA Cloud
Close 15+ net new SAP RISE with Microsoft co-sell deals
Build SAP Basis engineering team to 150 certified practitioners globally
Launch Rackspace SAP Migration Factory accelerator with 6-week onboarding SLA

name: Customer Success and Retention Transformation
description: Initiative to reduce customer churn, improve NPS, and increase wallet share through proactive customer success management. Driven by elevated churn rates in the managed cloud segment disclosed in 2022-2024 10-K and earnings calls. Encompasses implementation of Customer Success Management (CSM) tooling (Gainsight), restructuring of post-sales support tiers, creation of dedicated technical account manager (TAM) function, and development of customer health scoring. Seattle Children's Hospital 10-year MSA (ctr-017) serves as reference flagship outcome.
okrs_fy2025: Reduce managed cloud gross churn to below 12% annualized by Q4 FY2025
Achieve NPS score of 45+ across enterprise customer base
Hire VP Customer Success and staff CSM function to 80 headcount
Deploy Gainsight health scoring to 100% of enterprise accounts by Q2
Increase average wallet share by 15% through structured expansion plays

name: Data Platform and AI Readiness (Rackspace Data Services)
description: Initiative to build Rackspace's data engineering and AI/ML managed services practice on top of the existing cloud operations foundation. Encompasses launch of managed data lake and lakehouse services (AWS Lake Formation, Azure Synapse), AI/ML operations (MLOps) managed services, and Rackspace AI data readiness assessments. Palantir partnership (ctr-018) provides enterprise AI platform capability. Positions Rackspace for the CDAIO buying center alongside traditional CISO and CIO relationships. Revenue from data services expected to represent 15-20% of total bookings by 2026.

name: Public Cloud Bookings Acceleration
description: Public Cloud BU program to sustain and accelerate the 22% bookings growth trajectory achieved in FY2024 into FY2025. Encompasses sales capacity expansion, hyperscaler co-sell amplification (AWS Strategic Collaboration Agreement Oct 2024), pipeline velocity improvement, and deal size expansion through cross-sell of data and AI services. Revenue turned positive in Q3 2025 (+1% YoY). This program owns the quarterly bookings cadence for the Public Cloud BU and coordinates with AWS, Azure, and GCP practice leaders on quota attainment. Sub-program supporting INIT-001 (Cloud and AI Revenue Growth). Sourced from FY2024 10-K, Q4 2024 and Q3 2025 earnings calls.

name: Multi-Cloud Customer Migration Factory
description: Public Cloud BU program to build a repeatable, automation-first migration factory capable of executing 500+ customer workload migrations annually. Built on the AWS Migration Acceleration Program (MAP) and Rackspace Rapid Migration Offer (RRMO) on AWS Marketplace. Includes standardized migration playbooks for lift-and-shift, re-platform, and re-architect scenarios, supported by Infrastructure-as-Code templates and cloud landing zone automation. Microsoft Azure migration capabilities added under Azure Expert MSP (ctr-029). Directly supports the INIT-001 goal of 500+ legacy hosting customer migrations. Sourced from FY2024 10-K, AWS partnership disclosures, and Azure Expert MSP certification materials.

description: FAIR (Foundry for AI by Rackspace) program to commercialize the AIDE (AI Developer Experience) platform and scale Rackspace AI managed services to $50M+ ARR. AIDE announced at AWS re:Invent 2023 and Microsoft Ignite 2023. FAIR practice has executed 70+ enterprise AI implementations across its three-stage model (Ideate, Incubate, Industrialize). Program encompasses AIDE GA launch, Microsoft Copilot Services delivery, Palantir AIP co-delivery (ctr-018), and Private AI on bare metal for regulated industries. AI services bookings more than doubled in FY2024 per Q4 2024 earnings call. Sub-program supporting INIT-003 (AI-First Service Portfolio). name: Private Cloud Revenue Stabilization
description: Private Cloud BU program to arrest multi-year revenue decline and achieve flat-to-positive revenue in H2 2025, as guided in the Q4 2024 earnings call. Private cloud revenue declined 13% in FY2024 ($1,055M) but H2 2024 bookings grew 42% vs H1 2024, demonstrating a demand turnaround. Program encompasses 250+ new logo acquisition in vertical markets (healthcare, public sector), larger deal pursuit, and customer retention through improved service delivery. Private cloud revenue was -3% YoY in Q3 2025 with Q4 2025 guidance of -1% sequential — the deceleration trajectory is tracking toward the flat guidance. Sub-program supporting INIT-006 (Private Cloud Stabilization and Differentiation). Sourced from Q4 2024 earnings call transcript, Q3 2025 earnings results, and FY2024 annual report.

Win 250+ net new logos in private cloud across healthcare and public sector verticals

Expand average private cloud contract value by 25% through larger deal pursuit

name: Custom and Sovereign Cloud Expansion
description: Private Cloud BU program to grow differentiated revenue through custom cloud and sovereign cloud solutions for regulated industries and government markets. Rackspace UK Sovereign Cloud supports PSN and NHS Digital workloads; broader sovereign strategy targets national data sovereignty requirements in Europe, APAC, and the Middle East. Custom cloud builds for financial services, healthcare, and defense customers are a primary driver of larger deal sizes ($5M+ TCV) that contributed to the H2 2024 bookings acceleration. VMware Sovereign Cloud designation enables multi-tenant sovereign private cloud delivery. Sub-program supporting INIT-006 (Private Cloud Stabilization and Differentiation). Sourced from FY2024 10-K, UK Sovereign Cloud product pages, and Q4 2024 earnings call commentary on larger deal dynamics.
initiative_lead: Jon Mullapudy (SVP & GM OpenStack & Private Cloud, EMP-093)

name: FedRAMP Maintenance and DoD IL4 Authorization
description: Rackspace Government Solutions program to maintain the FedRAMP JAB P-ATO for AWS and Azure managed service delivery and achieve DoD Impact Level 4 (IL4) authorization for cloud workloads. The existing FedRAMP authorization covers AWS GovCloud and Azure Government managed operations. IL4 extends coverage to Controlled Unclassified Information (CUI) for DoD workloads, unlocking SEWP V (ctr-027) and GSA MAS (ctr-026) task order eligibility for defense agencies. Reston Federal Government Office (site-002) provides the cleared workforce. Carahsoft GSA partnership supports civilian agency reach. Sub-program supporting INIT-004 (Federal Market Expansion). Sourced from FedRAMP marketplace listing, Rackspace Government Cloud product pages, GSA/SEWP contract disclosures, and FY2024 10-K.
executive_sponsor: Thomas Cole (SVP Federal / Board Director, EMP-089)

Expand Reston cleared workforce to 150 personnel by Q4 FY2025
Achieve CMMC Level 2 certification for Rackspace Government Cloud delivery personnel

name: Customer Success Platform Build and Churn Reduction
description: Commercial Organization program to build the Gainsight-based Customer Success Management (CSM) platform, staff the CSM function to 80 headcount, and reduce managed cloud gross churn below 12% annualized. Elevated churn rates in the managed cloud segment were disclosed as a risk factor in the FY2022, FY2023, and FY2024 10-K filings. The VP Customer Success role is listed as open. Initiative deploys Gainsight customer health scoring across all enterprise accounts, creates Technical Account Manager (TAM) coverage for named accounts, and implements structured expansion plays to increase wallet share. Seattle Children's Hospital 10-year MSA (ctr-017) is a reference outcome of this approach. Sub-program supporting INIT-011 (Customer Retention and Expansion). Sourced from FY2024 10-K risk factors, Rackspace Gainsight partnership page, and Q3/Q4 2024 earnings calls.

name: Project Eagle Phase 2 — Automation and Vendor Optimization
description: Finance and Operations program representing the second phase of Project Eagle, the $100M+ cost reduction initiative disclosed in Rackspace 10-K filings. Phase 2 focuses on automation-driven reduction of managed services labor cost and systematic vendor contract renegotiation. Managed services support automation targets 40%+ of tier-1 interactions; vendor spend reduction targets 15% through MSA renegotiations across the top 25 technology and services vendors. Data center footprint consolidation to 11 core facilities reduces power and facilities costs. Workforce rebalancing shifts delivery labor mix toward lower-cost regions (India, Egypt, Mexico). Sub-program supporting INIT-002 (Operational Cost Optimization). Sourced from FY2023-FY2024 10-K restructuring disclosures, Project Eagle naming in earnings calls, and Apollo portfolio efficiency mandate.

Reduce top-25 vendor spend by 15% through renegotiated MSAs by Q3 FY2025

Shift 20%+ of delivery headcount to lower-cost regions (India, Egypt, Mexico) by Q4 FY2025
Achieve $50M+ incremental annualized savings in H2 FY2025 from Phase 2 actions

name: SOC Rebuild and Zero Trust Deployment
description: AI, Technology & Sustainability Organization program to rebuild the Security Operations Center (SOC) and deploy Zero Trust Network Access (ZTNA) following the November 2023 PLAY ransomware attack on Rackspace Hosted Exchange. The CISO role was vacant as of FY2024 10-K filing. Program encompasses SOC platform modernization (SIEM upgrade to Splunk/Microsoft Sentinel), 24x7 CSOC and ISOC operations rebuild, ZTNA deployment via Zscaler/Palo Alto Prisma to 100% of remote workforce, EDR refresh across 7,000+ managed endpoints, and the RAISE AI Security Engine for automated threat detection. Rubrik cyber recovery partnership (ctr-023) was a direct procurement output. Sub-program supporting INIT-008 (Cybersecurity Posture Restoration). Sourced from Rackspace SEC 8-K filings (Nov-Dec 2023), FY2024 10-K cybersecurity risk section, Rubrik partnership press release, and RAISE AI Security Engine product page.

Deploy ZTNA to 100% of remote Rackspace workforce by Q3 FY2025
Complete EDR refresh on all 7,000+ managed endpoints by Q2 FY2025
Reduce MTTD to under 15 minutes for critical-severity security events by Q4 FY2025
Achieve SOC 2 Type II re-certification across all managed cloud service lines by Q3 FY2025

name: APAC AI Services Launch
description: Asia Pacific & Japan Region program to build and commercialize Rackspace AI managed services capability across Australia, Singapore, India, and Hong Kong markets. Leverages the SYD2 and SIN2 data center expansions and the India engineering hub (Ramesh Babu team) as the delivery backbone. NVIDIA GPU clusters at SIN2 provide the infrastructure for Private AI and LLM inference workloads. Program targets 5+ APAC AI reference customers by year-end and positions Rackspace for the APAC financial services and government AI adoption wave. Sub-program supporting INIT-007 (Asia Pacific Growth). Sourced from APAC regional disclosures in FY2024 10-K, SYD2/SIN2 data center expansions, India engineering hub public announcements, and Q3 2025 earnings call APAC commentary.
initiative_lead: Martin Dubé (VP Public Cloud APJ, EMP-096)
okrs_fy2025: Launch GPU-accelerated AI services in SIN2 by Q2 FY2025
Close 5+ APAC AI managed services reference customer contracts by Q4 FY2025
Certify 150 India engineering hub engineers on AWS and Azure AI platforms by Q3 FY2025
Achieve AWS Generative AI Competency in APAC region by Q2 FY2025
Generate $10M+ AI services ARR from APAC region by Q4 FY2025

quarterly_milestones_fy2025.Q1: SIN2 GPU cluster expansion complete; India AI certification cohort 1 (50 engineers) started
quarterly_milestones_fy2025.Q2: AWS GenAI Competency APAC achieved; SIN2 AI services live; first 2 APAC AI contracts signed
quarterly_milestones_fy2025.Q3: 150 India engineers AI-certified; 3 APAC AI reference customers contracted; $5M APAC AI ARR
quarterly_milestones_fy2025.Q4: 5 APAC AI contracts; $10M AI ARR APAC; APAC AI GTM launched in ANZ and SEA financial services

name: SAP RISE Migration Factory
description: Public Cloud BU program to build a repeatable SAP RISE with Microsoft migration factory on Azure, targeting enterprise manufacturing, CPG, and retail customers. Rackspace is a certified SAP on Azure managed service provider under the Azure Expert MSP designation (ctr-029). The TriCore Solutions acquisition (2017) established the SAP Basis engineering foundation. SAP RISE with Microsoft is a joint Microsoft-SAP go-to-market where Azure Expert MSPs like Rackspace co-sell migration and managed services. General Mills (cust-083) is an existing manufacturing reference account. Program targets 15+ RISE co-sell deals and SAP Recognized Expertise designation for S/4HANA Cloud. Sub-program supporting INIT-010 (Microsoft Alliance Deepening). Sourced from Azure Expert MSP certification disclosure, SAP partnership page, ctr-029, cust-083, and TriCore acquisition disclosures.
okrs_fy2025: Achieve SAP Recognized Expertise designation for S/4HANA Cloud by Q2 FY2025
Close 15+ SAP RISE with Microsoft co-sell deals in FY2025
Launch SAP Migration Factory with standardized 12-week RISE onboarding methodology
Build SAP Basis practice to 150 certified engineers globally by Q4 FY2025
Generate $35M+ SAP managed services ARR by Q4 FY2025

quarterly_milestones_fy2025.Q1: SAP Recognized Expertise application submitted; Migration Factory pilot with 2 design-partner customers
quarterly_milestones_fy2025.Q2: SAP Expertise designation received; 5 RISE co-sells closed; factory methodology documented
quarterly_milestones_fy2025.Q3: SAP Migration Factory GA; 10 RISE deals; 100 SAP Basis engineers certified; General Mills expansion
quarterly_milestones_fy2025.Q4: 15 RISE deals; SAP Basis at 150; $35M SAP ARR; factory at 95%+ on-time delivery SLA

name: Managed Data Lake and Lakehouse Services Launch
description: FAIR program to launch managed data lake and lakehouse services on AWS (Lake Formation, S3) and Azure (Azure Synapse, ADLS), building on data services bookings that more than doubled in FY2024. Rackspace holds 300+ certified DBAs and runs practices on Snowflake, Databricks, and Azure Synapse. The Palantir partnership (ctr-018) provides enterprise AI platform delivery capability atop the data foundation. Program targets $30M data services ARR by year-end and positions Rackspace to serve the CDO and CDAIO buying centers alongside existing CISO and CIO relationships. ISG Provider Lens Leader designation for Data Analytics and AI/ML on AWS provides third-party validation. Sub-program supporting INIT-012 (Data Services Buildout). Sourced from Q4 2024 earnings call (data services bookings >2x), ISG Provider Lens 2024, Snowflake/Databricks/Synapse partner pages, and FY2024 10-K data services commentary.
okrs_fy2025: Launch managed data lake service on AWS GA by Q2 FY2025
Launch managed lakehouse service on Azure Synapse GA by Q3 FY2025
Grow data services ARR to $30M+ by Q4 FY2025 (building on >2x bookings growth in FY2024)
Build data engineering practice to 200 certified practitioners (Databricks, Snowflake, Synapse) by Q4
Complete 10+ Rackspace AI Data Readiness Assessments for Fortune 1000 customers
